pages.text: The $(l)$(o)Mining Rig Computer$(), when placed inside a $(l:machines/miner#chunk_scanner)$(t:Chunk Scanner)$(l)$(o)$(#0000ff)scanned$() chunk will start mining at cost of energy. Note that it does not break blocks.$(br)The Computer costs $(#1111FF)64LF/tick$() and each Drill will increase energy usage in $(#1111FF)256LF/tick$()

Mining Rig Drills are required for the Mining Rig Computer to work. They have to be placed next to the Computer and require drill heads to work. Each Drill increases the mining speed.$(br)Screenshot of a functional setup:

pages.title: Example
pages.text: Note that the Drills can be placed connected or diagonally to the Mining Rig Computer.
The $(l)$(o)Chunk Scanner$() is a tool used to collect geographical data on the chunk's vein type. After being scanned, the Scanner will give you a result which is required by the Miner to work.

pages.title: Peat
pages.text: Mainly composed by $(#000000)$(l)Coal Ore$(), it's the smallest and poorest coal vein, which means you'll be getting a lot of stone, dirt and some gravel.$(br)It can be found in any biomes, but more commonly in plains, taigas, forests, swamps and icy biomes.

pages.title: Lignite
pages.text: Mainly composed by $(#000000)$(l)Coal Ore$(), it's the second smallest and poorest coal vein, which means there's still a lot of stone, dirt and gravel here.$(br)It can be found in any biomes, but more commonly in plains, taigas, forests, swamps and biomes.

pages.title: Bituminous
pages.text: Mainly composed by $(#000000)$(l)Coal Ore$(), it's a quite big and rich coal vien, which means you'll find more coal alongside stone, dirt and gravel, but if you're lucky, you might just find some $(#00ffff)$(l)Diamonds$() too.$(br)It can be found in many places but more commonly in deserts, hills, mesas, savannas.

pages.title: Anthracite
pages.text: Mainly composed by $(#000000)$(l)Coal Ore$(), it's a the biggest and richest coal vein, which means there's a lot of coal, alongside stone, dirt, gravel and some $(#00ffff)$(l)Diamonds$() too.$(br)It can be found in many places but more commonly in deserts, hills, mesas, savannas.

pages.title: Siderite
pages.text: Mainly composed by $(#666666)$(l)Iron Ore$(), it's the smallest and poorest iron vein, with lots of stone, dirt, and some gravel.$(br)It can be found in many places but more commonly hills, plains, savannas and forests.

pages.title: Limonite
pages.text: Mainly composed by $(#666666)$(l)Iron Ore$(), it's the second smallest and poorest iron vein, with lots of of stone, dirt and gravel here.$(br)It can be found in many places but more commonly on hills, plains and deserts.

pages.title: Hematite
pages.text: Mainly composed by $(#666666)$(l)Iron Ore$(), it's a quite big and rich iron vein, with lots of iron alongside stone, dirt and some gravel.$(br)It can be found in many places but more commonly on taigas and mesas.

pages.title: Magnetite
pages.text: Mainly composed by $(#666666)$(l)Iron Ore$(), it's the biggest and richest iron vein, with lots of iron, alongside stone, dirt and some gravel.$(br)It can be found in many places but more commonly on hills, mesas and deserts.

pages.title: Chalcopryte
pages.text: Mainly composed by $(#FFA500)$(l)Copper Ore$() and $(#666666)$(l)Iron Ore$(), it's the quite rich and very variable vein, with lots of $(#FFA500)$(l)copper$() and $(#666666)$(l)iron$() ores alongside stone, dirt and gravel.$(br)It can be found in many places but more commonly on plains, savannas and forests.

pages.title: Cuprite
pages.text: Mainly composed by $(#FFA500)$(l)Copper Ore$(), it's the only vein that contains only copper, it's not very rich and very variable in size.$(br)It can be found in many places but more commonly on savannas and deserts.

pages.title: Cassiterite
pages.text: Mainly composed by $(#999999)$(l)Tin Ore$(), it's the only vein that contains only copper, it's not very rich and very variable in size.$(br)It can be found in many places but more commonly on plains, savannas and forests.

pages.title: Stannite
pages.text: Mainly composed by $(#999999)$(l)Tin Ore$(), $(#FFA500)$(l)Copper Ore$() and $(#666666)$(l)Iron Ore$(), with lots of tin, alongside $(#666666)$(l)iron$(), $(#FFA500)$(l)copper$(), stone, dirt and gravel.$(br)It can be found in many places but more commonly on hills, mesas and deserts.

pages.title: Nikolite
pages.text: Mainly composed by $(#5555BB)$(l)Nikolite Ore$(), $(#FF0000)$(l)Redstone Ore$() and $(#0000FF)$(l)Lapis Ore$(), with lots of stone, dirt and gravel. It can be found in many places but more commonly on taigas and icy biomes.

pages.title: Cavalerite
pages.text: $(l)Overworld$()$(br)Mainly composed by $(#FFD700)$(l)Gold Ore$(), it's a small and quite rich gold vein$(br)It can be found in many places but more commonly on taigas and mesas.

pages.title: Cavalerite (Nether)
pages.text: $(#ff0000)$(l)Nether$()$(br)It's a quite large and rich $(#FFD700)$(l)Nether Gold Ore$() vein, with lots of netherrack, soulsand, gravel, and if you're very lucky some $(l)$(#000000)Ancient Debris$() too!

pages.title: Quartz
pages.text: $(#ff0000)$(l)Nether$()$(br)It's a quite large and rich $(#dddddd)$(l)Quartz$() vein, with lots of netherrack, soulsand and gravel.
